data.question: What is the primary function of the Pb-Based MOF discussed in the text?
What type of structure does SM-3 exhibit according to the crystallographic studies?
What interactions provide stability to the SM-3 framework?
data.answer: Pb···π interactions, hydrogen bonding, and π-π stacking interactions

data.question: Is the adsorption of iodine by SM-3 reversible?
What is the maximum iodine uptake amount by SM-3 in the vapor phase?
Does SM-3 exhibit selective adsorption performance for cationic dyes from aqueous solution?
What is the equilibrium adsorption capacity of SM-3 for iodine in the solution phase?
Can SM-3 be recycled for iodine adsorption?
What is the role of uncoordinated nitrogen atoms in the SM-3 framework during iodine adsorption?
data.answer: Forming a charge transfer complex with iodine molecules

data.question: Is the adsorption technique mentioned as preferable due to its cost-effectiveness, smooth operation, and eco-friendliness?
What is the maximum adsorption capacity (qm) value of SM-3 for iodine according to the Langmuir model?
Does the presence of abundant π-electron-rich rings in SM-3 contribute to its excellent adsorbent properties?
What is the optimum pH for the adsorption of cationic dyes by SM-3?
Does SM-3 show a decrease in adsorption capacity for dyes at higher temperatures?
What type of interactions are primarily responsible for the adsorption of cationic dyes by SM-3?
data.answer: Electrostatic interactions, cation-π, and π-π interactions

data.question: Can SM-3 be used multiple times for dye adsorption with good efficiency?
What is the adsorption capacity of SM-3 for methylene blue (MB)?
Does the adsorption of iodine by SM-3 follow the pseudo-second-order kinetic model?
What is the role of anionic cloud created by NO3- ions in SM-3 during dye adsorption?
data.answer: Involved in strong electrostatic interactions with cationic dyes

data.question: Is the Langmuir model the best-fit model to represent the iodine adsorption process by SM-3?
